text: ANKARA Turkish lender Ziraat Bank replaced the majority of its top management team, and increased the number of deputy seats, after long-time chief executive Huseyin Aydin stepped down last month.Four of five deputy general managers have been replaced, while the number of deputy general managers were also increased to six, according to information on the banks website. The titles of deputy general managers were also tweaked.Late in March, the banks former deputy general manager, Alpaslan Cakar, was appointed as Aydins successor.
